intro: Hieracium nubigerum, commonly known as the cloud false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, thriving in temperate climates. Its yellow disk flowers are surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets, giving it a dandelion-like appearance. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
